inclusion.criterion: Live within the Baltimore Maryland area
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Finished active cancer treatment at least three months ago
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Overweight or obese and do not exercise daily
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: obese, mentally retarded girl in the physical exam

inclusion.criterion: Do not have any physical limitation to do mild to moderate physical activities
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Have a smart phone (iPhone or Android device) with Wi-Fi internet connection at home
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to accept the random study assignment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to wear a Fitbit band 'a physical activity tracking device' on your wrist for five weeks every single day
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to have an Echo speaker 'a smart home speaker with voice assistant' installed in your home and use the digital voice assist for four weeks
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to receive daily text messages on your phone for four weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to provide us with access to your Fitbit physical activities data
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Already doing moderate to high physical activities in their daily life (rapid screener)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Planning to relocate within the next 4-5 weeks
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Already using physical activity tracker or part of a physical activity program
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient is treating with GH since 6 months ago

exclusion.criterion: Part of another study that may interfere with our outcome of interest, unstable mental condition
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Mental condition that prevents patient from performing the study activities and requirements
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: mentally retarded girl in the physical exam

notes: Patient has Turner syndrome, is treating with GH, and has a mental condition that may prevent her from performing study activities.
